page.title: 18Farming_A typical farm
page.content: Easton farm covers 239 hectares and is situated 8 km. south of Grantham.It is a rented farm run by Mr. skelton who came to this area in 1955.It is a mixed farm with a large dairy herd (128)on the clay land to the east of the main farm buildings.The herd produces 1850 litres of milk a day.The cows calf in September/October, being served by one of four bulls. They are milked twice a day and are fed on silage during the Winter months.This was covered by polythene and had a very strong smell. The main crops Mr.Skelton grows are winter wheat, oil seed rape and maize.The busiest time of the year is from August to October.In August the crops are harvested by the 5 combine harvestors.Some of the straw is bailed most is burnt and winter wheat sown.Mr Skelton enjoys farming in this area.
